pr_title: test: TrackedEntityInstances API data read tests

timeline.message: Set up test to use /me and /metadata to decide access
removed temporary fixes from this branch

timeline.bodyText: I think this should go to its own class, somewhere in org.hisp.dhis.dto package
timeline.author: vilkg

replies.bodyText: Now that I read everything, I guess this is more tailored to this specific test, so scratch that. We could reuse it with some modifications, read more here: https://github.com/rest-assured/rest-assured/wiki/Usage#object-mapping.
replies.author: vilkg

replies.bodyText: I rewrote and moved the /me response this way. I was about to do the same for /metadata, but after I got into it, I realized it would results in a lot of different files only support this single use-case, so I decided to keep it the way it is. I also moved the User class into it's own file to keep the test itself a bit cleaner :)
replies.author: stian-sandvold

timeline.bodyText: Here you could use teiActions.postFile(''), since you don't do any modifications to the file
timeline.author: vilkg

timeline.bodyText: Did you try importAndValidateMetadata() ? We might want to have validation here, since it will affect test execution if there are conflicts and metadata is not imported.
timeline.author: vilkg

timeline.bodyText:
For better reporting, I would use rest-assured validation here. In that case, assertion failure here will be displayed with request, response and more meaningful message other than "Assertion failed. Expected true, but was false".
It would be something like response.validate().statusCode(200).body(_TEIS', is(notEmptyArray()))
timeline.author: vilkg

timeline.bodyText:
In all the asserts, provide a meaningful message as well for better reporting. For example:
assertTrue(String.format('Object %s with id %s was marked as deleted', .. .. ), object.has( _DELETED ) && !object.get( _DELETED ).getAsBoolean())
timeline.author: vilkg

timeline.message: Cleaned up the code a bit. Removed useless code and moved some code out of the test
Fixed NPE when publicAccess is not set

timeline.bodyText: that is admin: district, not necessarily super user. If you want super, you can use loginAsSuperuser()
timeline.author: vilkg
